Class MyGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.app.Application
      • com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
        • MyGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme3.system.SystemListener

    public class MyGame
extends com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
    Fingerübung_VCP2012_Markus_Strobel
    Author:
    Markus Strobel Matrikelnummer: 3545258 sources: the methods initFloor, createKevaPlank, createBall, initTerrain_Skybox, initHUD are generally based on the code of the tutorials with some minor or major changes but also other methods are created with the tutorial experiences the heightmap, alphamap and the snowpeak texture are selfmade with GIMP the textures grass_dark.jpg, WoodFine0018_L.jpg, BrickRound0044_3_L.jpg are for free and from www.CGTextures.com

      • initFloor

        private void initFloor(com.jme3.math.Vector3f position,
             float length,
             float height,
             float width,
             com.jme3.material.Material material,
             java.lang.Boolean border)
        This method is the floor/platform of the players (based on the tutorial HelloPhysics)
        Parameters:
        position - the centre position of the players platform
        length - the half length of the platform
        height - the half height of the platform
        width - the half width of the platform
        material - the material of the platform
        border - if the platform has a border to avoid falling of the platform

      • floor_border

        private void floor_border(com.jme3.math.Vector3f position,
                float length,
                float height,
                float width,
                com.jme3.material.Material material)
        This method creates a box for the floor border
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the box
        length - the length of the box
        width - the width of the box

      • initKevaPlankSimpleTower

        public void initKevaPlankSimpleTower(com.jme3.math.Vector3f startposition,
                            com.jme3.scene.Node playerNode,
                            int height_max,
                            int length_max,
                            com.jme3.material.Material material,
                            java.lang.Boolean roof,
                            float planksMass)
        This method initialize the Keva Planks Tower and creates the neccessary floor
        Parameters:
        startposition - the position of the towers centre
        playerNode - the node where all keva planks will be added to (this is useful to count them)
        height_max - the stages of the tower
        length_max - how many keva planks will be set in row -> causes the tower dimension to scale with it: 1 = 1x1, 2 = 2x2, 3 = 3x3, etc
        material - the material texture of the keva planks
        roof - if their should be a roof or not (not yet implemented)
        planksMass - the mass of each keva plank

      • initHUD

        private void initHUD()
        This method initialize the HUD

        private void initLight()

        private void initPlayers(com.jme3.math.Vector3f player1_position,
               com.jme3.math.Vector3f player2_position,
               float stepHeight)
        This method initiates the players
        Parameters:
        player1_position - the position of player1
        player2_position - the position of player2

      • initKeys

        This method initialize the key input settings (based on the tutorial code HelloInput)

      • createTeaPot

        private void createTeaPot(com.jme3.math.Vector3f position)
        This method creates a tea pot at the given position (based on the tutorial code HelloAnimation)
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the tea pot

      • initCastle_v1

        private void initCastle_v1(com.jme3.math.Vector3f position,
                 com.jme3.scene.Node node,
                 int towerHeight,
                 int midHeight,
                 com.jme3.material.Material towerMat,
                 com.jme3.material.Material midMat,
                 float towerPlanksMass,
                 float planksMass)
        This method builds a castle around his position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position where the castle will build around
        node - the node which the planks will be attached to
        towerHeight - how many plank rows will stacked at the corners
        midHeight - how many plank rows will stacked at the mid "walls"
        towerMat - the material of the towers in the corner
        midMat - the material of the walls in the mid
        towerPlanksMass - the mass of the tower planks
        planksMass - the mass of the wall planks

      • createKevaPlank

        public void createKevaPlank(java.lang.String name,
                   com.jme3.math.Vector3f position,
                   float rotate_xAngle,
                   float rotate_yAngle,
                   float rotate_zAngle,
                   float mass,
                   float length,
                   float height,
                   float width,
                   com.jme3.material.Material material,
                   com.jme3.scene.Node node)
        This method create a keva plank
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the keva plank
        position - the position of the keva planks' centre
        rotate_xAngle - the rotation around the x axis
        rotate_yAngle - the rotation around the y axis
        rotate_zAngle - the rotation around the z axis
        mass - the mass of the keva plank
        length - the length of the keva plank
        width - the width of the keva plank
        height - the height of the keva plank
        material - the material of the keva plank
        node - the node which the keva planks will be attached to

      • createBall

        public void createBall(float mass,
              com.jme3.scene.Spatial model)
        This method creates a ball and is based on the tutorial HelloPhysics
        Parameters:
        mass - the mass of the ball
        model - the model is required for the spawn position of the ball, because the ball needs some distance to the model
